content: across again o turn the top band and handle are now thicker and stronger row 9 loose slip_stitch row this last row gives a nice finished edge 1 chain 1 2 work a loose slip_stitch in each stitch across the row o insert hook into the next stitch o yarn over o pull through the stitch and the loop on the hook in one motion 3 keep your gauge very soft so the top edge does not cinch in 4 fasten_off and weave in your tail repeat all these edging + handle steps on the second panel join the two panels into a bag pg 27 www hodgepodge-crochet com now both panels are 3 squares wide by 2 tall have top edging + handle time to join them into a bag shape 1 put the two panels together with the outside pretty sides facing each other o so the handles are facing inward for now 2 line up the sides and bottom edges carefully 3 choose one join method whip stitch slip_stitch or single_crochet join 4 join o one side seam from top to bottom o then the bottom edge o then the other side seam leave the top with the handles open when you turn the bag right side out your handles and seams will all show on the pretty side when you finish your bag don t forget to add your project on ravelry it helps other crocheters see how the pattern works up in different colors and yarns and i love getting to celebrate your finished makes pg 28
